abstract: The Agricultural Bank of China, one of the nation’s biggest lenders, will sell a 15 percent stake in what may be the world’s largest initial public offering on record, the company said in an preliminary prospectus posted Friday.
snippet: The Agricultural Bank of China, one of the nation’s biggest lenders, will sell a 15 percent stake in what may be the world’s largest initial public offering on record, the company said in an preliminary prospectus posted Friday.
lead_paragraph: The Agricultural Bank of China, one of the nation’s biggest lenders, will sell a 15 percent stake in what may be the world’s largest initial public offering on record, the company said in an eagerly awaited preliminary prospectus posted Friday on the securities regulator’s Web site.

abstract: Amid its legal troubles here, Goldman Sachs has become the latest object of scorn in the Chinese press, apparently driven in part by its continuing financial success in that country.
snippet: Amid its legal troubles here, Goldman Sachs has become the latest object of scorn in the Chinese press, apparently driven in part by its continuing financial success in that country.
lead_paragraph: 12:59 p.m. | Updated For years, Goldman Sachs has built up its operations in China, becoming perhaps the most successful Western financial firm in that red-hot market.
